thread.title: Michigan governor OKs $9.3M to end Flint water crisis
thread.title_full: Michigan governor OKs $9.3M to end Flint water crisis - US News

author: USNews
title: Michigan governor OKs $9.3M to end Flint water crisis
text:
Michigan governor approves $9.3M to solve Flint water crisis, includes $6M to switch source Associated Press Oct. 15, 2015 | 5:11 p.m. EDT + More By DAVID EGGERT, Associated Press
LANSING, Mich. (AP) â€” A Michigan city will receive $6 million in state funding to help switch its drinking water source after lead and other problems.
Gov. Rick Snyder approved nearly $9.4 million in aid for Flint on Thursday, the same day lawmakers finalized the legislation. It also includes money for water filters, inspections and lab testing.
Flint stopped getting its water from Detroit's system last year in a cost-cutting move but has had trouble with water from the Flint River.
The state corroborated findings of elevated lead levels in children and disclosed higher levels in three Flint schools. Residents have complained about the water's safety, smell, taste and appearance.
Returning to Detroit will cost $12 million through June.
Flint will pay $2 million. The Charles Stewart Mott Foundation has pledged $4 million.
